paper_title.en: C-2-saddle method and Beukers' integral

description.en: We give good non-quadraticity measures for the values of logarithm at specific rational points by modifying Beukers' double integral. The two-dimensional version of the saddle method, which we call C-2-saddle method, is applied.

paper_title.en: The irrationality of log(1+1/q),log(1-1/q)

description.en: We shall show that the numbers 1, log(1 + 1/q),log(1 - 1/q) and log(1 + 1/q) log(1 - 1/q) are linearly independent over Q for any natural number q greater than or equal to 54. The key is to construct explicit Pade-type approximations using Legendre-type polynomials.

paper_title.en: REMARKS ON MAHLER TRANSCENDENCE-MEASURE-FOR-E
paper_title.ja: Remarks On Mahler′s Transcendence Measure for e

description.en: A sightly improved classical transcendence measure for e will be given, by showing that the absolute constant in Mahler's measure can be taken to be 1. We also give an improved linear independence measure for the system 1, e,..., e(n). (C) 1995 Academic Press, Inc.

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF NUMBER THEORY

paper_title.en: A NOTE ON BEUKERS INTEGRAL

description.en: The aim of this note is to give a sharp lower bound for rational approximations to zeta(2) = pi(2)/6 by using a specific Beukers' integral. Indeed, we will show that pi(2) has an irrationality measure less than 6.3489, which improves the earlier result 7.325 announced by D. V. Chudnovsky and G. V. Chudnovsky.

paper_title.en: RATIONAL-APPROXIMATIONS TO THE DILOGARITHM

description.en: The irrationality proof of the values of the dilogarithmic function L2(z) at rational points z = 1/k for every integer k is-an-element-of (-infinity, -5] or [7, infinity) is given. To show this we develop the method of Pade-type approximations using Legendre-type polynomials, which also derives good irrationality measures of L2(1/k) . Moreover, the linear independence over Q of the numbers 1 , log(1 - 1/k) , and L2(1/k) is also obtained for each integer k is-an-element-of (-infinity , -5] or [7, infinity).

paper_title.en: DIFFERENTIABLE FUNCTIONS WHICH DO NOT SATISFY A UNIFORM LIPSCHITZ CONDITION OF ANY ORDER

description.en: The aim of this paper is to construct two kinds of absolutely continuous functions. One is differentiable everywhere but does not satisfy a uniform Lipschitz condition of any order on some large class of subintervals, while the other is differentiable almost everywhere but does not satisfy a uniform Lipschitz condition of any order on any subintervals.
